intro: Cylichnanthus fimbriatus, commonly known as the fringed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, often purple or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in late summer and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
